title: GSA policies on "profanity" or "inappropriate" language in comments on Regulations.gov

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. All current (as of the date of this request) GSA policies, guidelines, rules, or standards used to determine whether comments (or other materials) submitted to Regulations.gov contain "profanity," "inappropriate" language, or otherwise unacceptable content, resulting in the deletion or exclusion of such comments from public view.

2. Any internal memoranda, training materials, manuals, or other documents issued or utilized by GSA staff concerning the identification and handling of comments (or other materials) submitted to Regulations.gov determined to be profane, inappropriate, or otherwise unacceptable for posting.

3. Records identifying any automated tools, software, or algorithms used by the GSA or contracted entities for scanning, flagging, or deleting comments to Regulations.gov based on profanity or inappropriate content.

4. Records reflecting the number of comments to Regulations.gov removed or withheld from posting due to profanity or inappropriate content from January 1, 2023, to the present.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: FCC policies on "profanity" or "inappropriate" language in public comments

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. All current (as of the date of this request) FCC policies, guidelines, rules, or standards used to determine whether comments (or other materials) submitted to public dockets contain "profanity," "inappropriate" language, or otherwise unacceptable content, resulting in the deletion or exclusion of such comments from public view.

2. Any internal memoranda, training materials, manuals, or other documents issued or utilized by FCC staff concerning the identification and handling of comments (or other materials) submitted to public dockets determined to be profane, inappropriate, or otherwise unacceptable for posting.

3. Records identifying any automated tools, software, or algorithms used by the FCC or contracted entities for scanning, flagging, or deleting comments to public dockets based on profanity or inappropriate content.

4. Records reflecting the number of comments to public dockets removed or withheld from posting due to profanity or inappropriate content from January 1, 2023, to the present.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh
